p: Globally, including adults and children, the World Health Organization estimates that millions of people are afflicted by treatable diseases. These include (in millions), diarrheal disease (4620), lower respiratory infections (429), malaria (241), measles (27), pertussis (18), dengue (9), tuberculosis (8), and HIV (2.8). Many of these diseases are disproportionately harming people in less developed countries.
